pull.title: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.0
pull.body: The new [VS 18.0](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes) release includes numerous bug fixes.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33861. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33861#issuecomment-3859093351) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#33974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33974) (cmake: Check dependencies after build option interaction by hebasto) * [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors) * [#31507](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31507) (build: Use clang-cl to build on Windows natively by hebasto) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Seems a bit premature, if this is still waiting for multiple pieces of unreleased software? Could just wait for it to be shown as fixed in a nightly build?

refactor: Remove workaround for resolved MSVC bug

The bug was fixed in Visual Studio 18.0.

events.message:
refactor: Remove workaround for resolved MSVC bug

The bug was fixed in Visual Studio 18.0.

events.body: I guess there's no issue here with us assuming everyone compiling/developing on Windows is using an editor that is < 3 months old (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes#november-update-1800)?

Also, according to #34515 this software is broken:
> Also, moving to Visual Studio 2026 (Community edition) is currently not an option, it ships with a [unusable vcpkg version](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/10998815).

but I guess this doesn't effect us, or at least our usage in CI?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -219,10 +219,10 @@ jobs:
         include:
           - job-type: standard
             generate-options: '-DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_KERNEL_LIB=ON -DBUILD_UTIL_CHAINSTATE=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2026'
           - job-type: fuzz
             generate-options: '-DVCPKG_MANIFEST_NO_DEFAULT_FEATURES=ON -DVCPKG_MANIFEST_FEATURES="wallet" -DBUILD_GUI=OFF -DWITH_ZMQ=OFF -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2026'
comments.body: could remove the version/year here, as the docs and presets should already be clear on it? (no other ci task is having the version/year in the title)

comments.body:
Yeah, https://github.com/actions/runner-images/tree/c218bde724e0ae9730d9ce101bca654a4c2e521d/images/windows/Windows2025-vs2026-Readme.md is a 404

I guess it doesn't matter as long as ci is green here :shrug:
